chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
antisym Z leZ

Premises:
antisym : forall A : Set, (A -> A -> Prop) -> Prop
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
leZ = fun x y : Z => match x with | OZ => match y with | neg _ => False | _ => True end | pos n => match y with | pos m => n <= m | _ => False end | neg n => match y with | neg m => m <= n | _ => True end end : Z -> Z -> Prop
sign_absZ : forall x : Z, leZ OZ (absZ x)
tech_le_pos_abs : forall x : Z, leZ OZ x -> absZ x = x
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
addZ = fun x1 x2 : Z => match x1 with | OZ => x2 | pos n => addpos x2 n | neg n => addneg x2 n end : Z -> Z -> Z
IdZ = fun _ : Z => True : Z -> Prop
absZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
sgnZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos _ => pos 0 | neg _ => neg 0 end : Z -> Z
oppZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => OZ | pos n => neg n | neg n => pos n end : Z -> Z
succZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => IZ | pos n => pos (S n) | neg 0 => OZ | neg (S m) => neg m end : Z -> Z
predZ = fun x : Z => match x with | OZ => neg 0 | pos 0 => OZ | pos (S m) => pos m | neg n => neg (S n) end : Z -> Z
is_posn = fun x z : Z => match x with | pos n => match z with | pos m => n = m | _ => False end | _ => False end : Z -> Z -> Prop
addneg = fix addneg (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => predZ x2 | S n0 => predZ (addneg x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addneg _ _%nat_scope
addpos = fix addpos (x2 : Z) (n : nat) {struct n} : Z := match n with | 0 => succZ x2 | S n0 => succZ (addpos x2 n0) end : Z -> nat -> Z Arguments addpos _ _%nat_scope
IZ = pos 0 : Z
addZ_commutativity = fun x y : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => addZ x0 y = addZ y x0) (eq_sym (add_OZ y)) (fun n : nat => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => addZ (pos n0) y = addZ y (pos n0)) (eq_sym (add_IZ_succZ y)) (fun (n0 : nat) (H : addZ (pos n0) y = addZ y (pos n0)) => eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => z = addZ y (pos (S n0))) (eq_ind_r (fun z : Z => succZ z = addZ y (pos (S n0))) (let H0 : succZ (pos n0) = pos (S n0) := eq_refl in (fun H1 : succZ (pos n0) = pos (S n0) => eq_ind (succZ (pos n0)) (fun z : Z => succZ (addZ y (pos...
addZ_associativity = fun x y z : Z => Z_ind (fun x0 : Z => addZ x0 (addZ y z) = addZ (addZ x0 y) z) eq_refl (fun n : nat => nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => addZ (pos n0) (addZ y z) = addZ (addZ (pos n0) y) z) (eq_sym (succ_addZ_l y z)) (fun (n0 : nat) (H : addZ (pos n0) (addZ y z) = addZ (addZ (pos n0) y) z) => eq_ind_r (fun z0 : Z => z0 = addZ (addZ (pos (S n0)) y) z) (eq_ind_r (fun z0 : Z => succZ (addZ (pos n0) (addZ y z)) = addZ z0 z) (eq_ind_r (fun z0 : Z => succZ (addZ (pos n0) (addZ...
addZ_neutral = conj I (fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj (add_OZ x) eq_refl) : neutral Z IdZ addZ OZ
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : BinNums.Z | Zpos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z | Zneg : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinNums.Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.Zneg _%positive_scope
posOZ = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => OZ | S n' => pos n' end : nat -> Z Arguments posOZ _%nat_scope
negOZ = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => OZ | S n' => neg n' end : nat -> Z Arguments negOZ _%nat_scope
Z_group = conj (fun (x y : Z) (_ : IdZ x) (H0 : IdZ y) => H0) (conj addZ_associativity (conj addZ_neutral addZ_opposite)) : is_group Z IdZ addZ OZ oppZ
Z_sind : forall P : Z -> SProp, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rect : forall P : Z -> Type, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_rec : forall P : Z -> Set, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z_ind : forall P : Z -> Prop, P OZ -> (forall n : nat, P (pos n)) -> (forall n : nat, P (neg n)) -> forall z : Z, P z
addZ_opposite = fun (x : Z) (_ : IdZ x) => conj I (conj I (conj match x as z return (addZ z (oppZ z) = OZ) with | OZ => eq_refl | pos n => tech_add_pos_negZ n | neg n => tech_add_neg_posZ n end match x as z return (addZ (oppZ z) z = OZ) with | OZ => eq_refl | pos n => tech_add_neg_posZ n | neg n => tech_add_pos_negZ n end)) : opposite Z IdZ addZ OZ oppZ
Record linear (C : Type) : Type := mk_linear { num : Ring_polynom.PExpr C; denum : Ring_polynom.PExpr C; condition : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) } Arguments Field_theory.linear _%type_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_linear [C]%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
Record ring_eq_ext (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_reqe { Radd_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) radd; Rmul_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rmul; Ropp_ext : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req req) ropp } Arguments ring_eq_ext [R]%type_scope (_ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments mk_reqe [R]%type_scope [radd rmul ropp req]%function_scope

```coq
Import Z.
Import antisym.
Proof.
intros.
unfold antisym.
apply Z_ind.
* intros.
  unfold antisym.
  apply (Z_rect (fun x => Z -> Prop) (fun _ => True) (fun _ => True) (fun _ => True)).
* intros.
  unfold antisym.
  apply (Z_rect (fun x => Z -> Prop) (fun _ => True) (fun _ => True) (fun _ => True)).
* intros.
  unfold antisym.
  apply (Z_rect (fun x => Z -> Prop) (fun _ => True) (fun _ => True) (fun _ => True)).
Qed.
